alert.note: Alert for Goliad; Inland Refugio; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 5:10PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN VICTORIA... SOUTHEASTERN GOLIAD AND NORTH CENTRAL REFUGIO COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 510 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fannin, or 10 miles southeast of Goliad, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Victoria, southeastern Goliad and north central Refugio Counties. This includes the following highways... US Highway 183 between mile markers 650 and 658. US Highway 59 near mile marker 662. US Highway 77 between mile markers 604 and 608. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
